page.title: 14CRICKET CLUB KILMARNOCK (4)
page.content: THE SPECIAL GUEST AT THE OPENING OF THE NEW PAVILION WAS AUSTRALIAN TEST CRICKETER,RAY PHILLIPS FROM BRISBANE, WHO WAS LOANED TO KILMARNOCK AT THE TIME OF THE 4th. TEST MATCH AT BIRMINGHAM AGAINST ENGLAND. IN THAT PARTICULAR TEST MATCH PHILLIPS WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE AUSTRALIAN TEAM AND THUS WAS AVAILABLE TO PLAY AS THE CLUB PROFESSIONAL FOR THE TWO WEEK-END LEAGUE MATCHES. THE SATURDAY GAME WAS AGAINST GREENOCK WHICH KILMARNOCK WON AFTER AN EXCITING MATCH. UNFORTUNATELY THE SUNDAY MATCH AGAINST UDDINGSTON,FROM LANARKSHIRE WAS RAINED OFF. THE SUMMER OF 1985 TURNED OUT TO BE THE WORST IN LIVING MEMORY AND A GREAT DEAL OF THE CRICKET WAS SIMPLY RAINED OFF.
